info.name: Trigeminal main sensory nucleus
info.description: The trigeminal main sensory nucleus is the portion of the trigeminal sensory nuclei located in the tegmentum of the pons. It receives tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive information from the head via large-diameter primary afferents in the trigeminal nerve. It is analogous to the dorsal column nuclei (gracilis and cuneatus) that serve the same function for the body. Efferents from this nucleus terminate primarily in the contralateral ventral posterior medial nucleus of the thalamus, although a small component terminates in the ipsilateral ventral posterior medial nucleus.
